title: WPIAL issues new punishment after high school pre-game fight
text:
WPIAL issues new punishment after high school pre-game fight New Castle and Central Valley testify at closed door hearing UPDATED 10:42 PM EDT Oct 19, 2015 A Large Text Photos 
The Western Pennsylvania Interscholastic Athletic League wanted more information about a brawl caught on camera at the New Castle vs. Central Valley high school football game Oct. 9. More 
At a hearing Monday afternoon, the WPIAL board heard testimony from school administrators, coaches and referees. 
The WPIAL accepted the punishments both schools handed down after the fight. New Castle High School suspended 13 players for one game and two coaches.The Central Valley School District suspended one player. 
The WPIAL board decided further punishment was necessary. It ordered one year probation of for the New Castle team and a public censure of its coach, Joe Cowart. That means the New Castle Red Hurricanes will be under the microscope and will face harsher penalties if players or coaches violate any rules. 
The board is also requiring both districts to develop sportsmanship protocols. The executive director of the WPIAL said violence is unacceptable, but, robust rivalries are a good thing. 
“We want that rivalry to continue,” said Executive Director Timothy O’Malley. “But in the continuance of the rivalry, we have an understanding of how it is that you compete against one another and the behavior you exhibit during the competition.”
